# VisuallyHidden Makes content accessible to screen readers but hides it visually. ## Basic usage Just wrap the content you want to hide visually, but keep accessible to screen readers, with the `VisuallyHidden` component. ```jsx const App = () => I am VisuallyHidden!; ``` ## Focusable content If the content you want to hide visually contains focusable elements, add the `isFocusable` property to the `VisuallyHidden` component. The content then becomes visible if the first focusable element inside is focused with the _keyboard_. ```jsx-live const App = () => ( ); ``` ## Inline content `VisuallyHidden` uses a `
` element by default to render into the DOM. If you need to hide inline content, you can use the `as` prop to render a `` element instead, keeping the `html` semantics intact. ```jsx-live const App = () => (

Text that will be visible. I will blend just in. Text that will be visible.

); ``` ## Props
